p: The 1997 HPAIV H5N1 outbreak in Hong Kong (the so-called clade zero viruses) has retrospectively been shown to have received its internal gene cassette (all genes except HA and NA) from co-circulating G1 lineage H9N2 viruses [ 10]. Genotype 57 (G57, also known as genotype S) viruses in China have recently become the predominant genotype circulating in poultry due to their enhanced fitness in poultry [ 16]. From 2013 onwards, reassortment between these G57 H9N2 viruses and other circulating subtypes resulted in the generation of multiple zoonotic AIVs with a high propensity to cause disease and death in humans as well as poultry such as: H7N9 [ 7], H10N8 [ 105] and, most recently, H5N6 all of which contain the six genes of the G57 internal gene cassette. Furthermore, several circulating HPAIV H5Nx viruses contain single or multiple genes from H9N2 [ 106, 107, 108], including the predominant genotype of H5 HPAIVs circulating in West Africa which contain a PB2 gene most likely donated from an H9N2 virus [ 109].
